column4: Hi. What's the current standard desktop kernel on natty? (i.e. output of uname -rv and package name)... I'm not sure if I've got it back to where it should be. Thanks :)
http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=linux-image&searchon=names&suite=natty&section=all
I'm still not sure if what I've got is right though
dpkg -l |grep linux-image
but that still doesn't answer my question. There are lots of kernel packages installed, and more available to me. I asked "What's the current standard desktop kernel on natty?"
and I told you. if you don't want to read it's not my problem
I have read. I don't understand how your answers answer my question.
linux-image-2.6.38-8-generic, linux-image-2.6.38-8-generic-pae depending on your hardware
hmmm.. I seem to have 3 of those installed. The #42-Ubuntu refers to me running the kernel provided by the linux-image-2.6.38-8-generic             2.6.38-8.42
package, right?
dpkg -l |grep linux-image  pastebin the output
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/628847/
pastebin your sources.list? looks like you had proposed updates or such

http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/628850/  I tried the server kernel to see if it would fix an issue, but it turned out to be something else that cause the problem. Now I'm trying to get back to the default desktop kernel
well, the 2.6.32.8-22 is the one you want to boot. and you can remove all those old ones
ok, so I should have linux-image-generic installed, and it's dependencies... or the linux-image package?
the linux-image package. so that the upgrades later work properly
thanks, lots of apt-work now to  :) (and to mrdeb)
which driver?
it's an intel mobile 4 chip... not sure how to tell which driver is actually running.
Xorg.0.log tells you. in your case, normally intel
yes, intel is the driver.

jrib: when it freezes, mouse still moves, but clicking and keyboard have no effect. All the processes still see to be running. Switching back to the vt with X11 on it gives me whatever was on my tty vt, plus a moving cursor
